intro: Campanumoea javanica var. japonica, commonly known as the Japanese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and partial to full sun. This ornamental plant is often cultivated for its attractive flowers and is relatively easy to care for in garden settings.
